verses.text: I commend unto you Phebe our sister, which is a servant of the church which is at Cenchrea:
That ye receive her in the Lord, as becometh saints, and that ye assist her in whatsoever business she hath need of you: for she hath been a succourer of many, and of myself also.

similars.text: And it is my purpose to provide for my saints, for all things are mine.
For he that receiveth my servants receiveth me;
Ye also helping together by prayer for us, that for the gift bestowed upon us by the means of many persons thanks may be given by many on our behalf.
That ye submit yourselves unto such, and to every one that helpeth with us, and laboureth.
Whoso receiveth you receiveth me; and the same will feed you, and clothe you, and give you money.
Praying us with much entreaty that we would receive the gift, and take upon us the fellowship of the ministering to the saints.

verses.text: Greet Priscilla and Aquila my helpers in Christ Jesus:

similars.text: The churches of Asia salute you. Aquila and Priscilla salute you much in the Lord, with the church that is in their house.
Salute Urbane, our helper in Christ, and Stachys my beloved.
Salute every saint in Christ Jesus. The brethren which are with me greet you.
Salute Prisca and Aquila, and the household of Onesiphorus.
The churches of Asia salute you. Aquila and Priscilla salute you much in the Lord, with the church that is in their house.

verses.text: Who have for my life laid down their own necks: unto whom not only I give thanks, but also all the churches of the Gentiles.
Likewise greet the church that is in their house. Salute my wellbeloved Epaenetus, who is the firstfruits of Achaia unto Christ.

similars.text: There salute thee Epaphras, my fellowprisoner in Christ Jesus;
I beseech you, brethren, (ye know the house of Stephanas, that it is the firstfruits of Achaia, and that they have addicted themselves to the ministry of the saints,)

And to our beloved Apphia, and Archippus our fellowsoldier, and to the church in thy house:

verses.text: Greet Mary, who bestowed much labour on us.
Salute Andronicus and Junia, my kinsmen, and my fellowprisoners, who are of note among the apostles, who also were in Christ before me.

similars.text: Timotheus my workfellow, and Lucius, and Jason, and Sosipater, my kinsmen, salute you.
And as I said unto mine apostles, even so I say unto you, for you are mine apostles, even God's high priests; ye are they whom my Father hath given me; ye are my friends;
Timotheus my workfellow, and Lucius, and Jason, and Sosipater, my kinsmen, salute you.

verses.text: Greet Amplias my beloved in the Lord.

similars.text: All that are with me salute thee. Greet them that love us in the faith. Grace be with you all. Amen.

Salute Rufus chosen in the Lord, and his mother and mine.
Salute Asyncritus, Phlegon, Hermas, Patrobas, Hermes, and the brethren which are with them.
Salute Philologus, and Julia, Nereus, and his sister, and Olympas, and all the saints which are with them.
Salute one another with an holy kiss. The churches of Christ salute you.

verses.text: Now I beseech you, brethren, mark them which cause divisions and offences contrary to the doctrine which ye have learned; and avoid them.

similars.text: Behold, this is not my doctrine, to stir up the hearts of men with anger, one against another; but this is my doctrine, that such things should be done away.

And now behold, my brethren, ye know that these commandments were given to our father, Lehi; wherefore, ye have known them before; and ye have come unto great condemnation; for ye have done these things which ye ought not to have done.

verses.text: For they that are such serve not our Lord Jesus Christ, but their own belly; and by good words and fair speeches deceive the hearts of the simple.

similars.text: For we preach not ourselves, but Christ Jesus the Lord; and ourselves your servants for Jesus' sake.

verses.text: For your obedience is come abroad unto all men. I am glad therefore on your behalf: but yet I would have you wise unto that which is good, and simple concerning evil.

similars.text: See that none render evil for evil unto any man; but ever follow that which is good, both among yourselves, and to all men.
And now, behold, for your good I gave unto you a commandment concerning these things; and I, the Lord, will reason with you as with men in days of old.
And it is given unto them to know good from evil; wherefore they are agents unto themselves, and I have given unto you another law and commandment.
And let every man deal honestly, and be alike among this people, and receive alike, that ye may be one, even as I have commanded you.

verses.text: And the God of peace shall bruise Satan under your feet shortly. The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you. Amen.

verses.text: Now to him that is of power to stablish you according to my gospel, and the preaching of Jesus Christ, according to the revelation of the mystery, which was kept secret since the world began,

similars.text: For I deign to reveal unto my church things which have been kept hid from before the foundation of the world, things that pertain to the dispensation of the fulness of times.
In the day when God shall judge the secrets of men by Jesus Christ according to my gospel.

verses.text: But now is made manifest, and by the scriptures of the prophets, according to the commandment of the everlasting God, made known to all nations for the obedience of faith:

similars.text: Because that which may be known of God is manifest in them; for God hath shewed it unto them.
But hath in due times manifested his word through preaching, which is committed unto me according to the commandment of God our Saviour;

verses.text: To God only wise, be glory through Jesus Christ for ever. Amen.
